text.author: Alex, Carolyn Barratt, WRM and others (see URL)
text.title: How to Grow Beavertail Cactus
text.summary: This guide explains how to grow Beavertail cactus, either from seeds in a shady garden in moist soil, leading to flowers in 4 years, or more quickly from cuttings, 6 months or older, cured in dry shade for 10-14 days, then planted upright in pots with drainage holes in the sun, watering after a month and letting soil dry, as well as fertilizing in spring, summer and fall.
text.summary2: Using detailed instructions of two growth methods, this article describes how Beavertail Cactus can grow either by scattering purchased seeds in a shady garden bed and waiting 4 years, or by planting Beavertail cuttings in a mix of soil and sand and ensuring there is plenty of sunlight to grow quicker compared to planting seeds.
